tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Chapter 3 focuses on the corrupt leaders in Israel.

tn.ref: I said
tn.text: Here "I" refers to Micah.

tn.ref: Is it not right for you to understand justice?
tn.text: Micah uses a question to scold the leaders because they were not protecting the people or treating them fairly. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: you who tear off their skin, their flesh from their bones ... just like meat in a cauldron
tn.text: Micah uses this terrible imagery of a butcher cutting up animals into meat to emphasize how upset God is with the leaders because of how cruel they are to those they should be protecting. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Micah continues speaking.

tn.ref: cry out to Yahweh
tn.text: "shout to Yahweh for help"

tn.ref: He will hide his face from you
tn.text: This means God will not hear their cries. They would not hear the cries of the poor, and so they receive the same treatment from God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Micah continues to speak judgment against false prophets.

tn.ref: it will be night for you ... the day will be dark on them
tn.text: Yahweh is saying in 3:6 these false prophets will no longer receive God's message to the people of Israel. Prophets sometimes got messages from God through visions, or dreams at night. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: The seers will be put to shame, and the diviners will be confused
tn.text: "I will cause the seers to be ashamed, and I will confuse the diviners" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: All of them will cover their lips
tn.text: "They shall no longer speak" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: for there is no answer from me
tn.text: This means God will be silent as part of their punishment.

tn.ref: But as for me
tn.text: The "me" here refers to Micah, a true prophet, setting himself apart from the false prophets.

tn.ref: I am full of power by the Spirit of Yahweh, and am full of justice and might
tn.text: The Spirit of Yahweh has chosen to give Micah power, justice, and might in a strong, special way. AT: "the Spirit of Yahweh has filled me with power, justice, and might" or "the Spirit of Yahweh has granted me power, justice, and might"

tn.ref: to declare to Jacob his transgression, and to Israel his sin
tn.text: Both of these phrases mean the same thing and emphasize that both the people of both the northern and southern kingdoms have sinned. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: You build Zion with blood and Jerusalem with iniquity
tn.text: The rich were building themselves beautiful homes often at the expense and mistreatment of the poor. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: blood
tn.text: Here "blood" refers to murder. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] )

tn.ref: Is not Yahweh with us? No evil will come on us.
tn.text: Micah quotes the leaders who wrongly think Yahweh would not punish them for their sinful deeds. The Hebrew word for "evil" here is the same as for "disaster" in 2:3, a key word in the book. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: because of you
tn.text: Here "you" refers to the priests, prophets, and leaders of the previous verse.

tn.ref: Zion will be plowed like a field, Jerusalem will be a heap of rubble, and the hill of the temple will be like a forested hill.
tn.text: Micah means that Jerusalem will be completely destroyed. A large city with many people living there will become abandoned and grow over like a field or forest. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: Zion will be plowed like a field
tn.text: After its destruction, Jerusalem will be available to plow. AT: "Other people will plow Zion like a field." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: and the hill of the temple will be like a forested hill.
tn.text: Not even the temple area will be spared. The leaders have corrupted it, and it will be destroyed too.
